intro: Oxytropis qaidamensis, commonly known as Qaidam oxytropis, is a flowering plant native to the Qaidam Basin in Qinghai, China. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, also known as the legume or bean family, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh climatic conditions. It has compound leaves and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain seeds. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a rare and valuable species in its native habitat.
